alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Faribault; Martin; Watonwan (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:01PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Faribault, northeastern Martin, southwestern Blue Earth and southeastern Watonwan Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 601 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Truman, or 7 miles north of Fairmont, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Winnebago around 615 PM CDT. Blue Earth around 620 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Delavan, Frost and Bricelyn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 97 and 142. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 2 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Minnesota. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Minnesota.
